messages.message:
can i suggest that for release version numbering, we do 22.01 instead of 22.1?

that way it sorts as
22.01
22.02
…
22.10
22.11

instead of
22.1
22.10
22.11
…
22.2
22.3
alright gonna rename it where i see it :slightly_smiling_face:

just curious, why is sorting important?
python release versions are 3.5,3.6,3.7,3.11,etc
don't think i have seen anything have 1.01 as version number

its cuz our versions are also related to the month that we cut the code and package it - so we have a fixed set of version numbers, and the ordering allows us to maintain the relationship to each month easily
This may break release scanning, which currently assumes releases are in a unpadded y.m format. Have we committed to this change?
